Models¶

class webapp.models.Activity(*args, **values)[source]¶

A limited amount of work done by a user on a given date and time.

serialize()[source]¶

Serialize this object

Returns:dict with parameters id, user, start, duration_str, minutes, description, billable
class webapp.models.Company(*args, **values)[source]¶

Company that executes work for a customer. A company can contain zero or more teams.

find_team(teamname)[source]¶

Find a team in this company’s list of teams

Parameters:teamname – the name of the team
Returns:the team. If the team is not found, a RuntimeError is raised.
remove_team(teamname)[source]¶

Removes a given team from this company’s list of teams

Parameters:teamname – the name of the team
serialize()[source]¶

Serialize this object

Returns:dict with keys name, address, registration_number, account_number, teams (list), created_at
class webapp.models.Customer(*args, **values)[source]¶

Customer for who a project is being done. All billing details should be set here.

serialize()[source]¶

Serialize this object

Returns:dict with parameters name, address, registration_number
class webapp.models.Project(*args, **values)[source]¶

A project done by a given team in a company for a customer. Team members can log activities done for a given project. A project also contains an agreed on hourly rate for billing.

find_activity(activityid)[source]¶

Find an activity in this projects list of activities

Parameters:activityid – the id of the activity
Returns:the activity. If the activity is not found, a RuntimeError is raised.
generate_invoice(start_date, end_date, template=None)[source]¶

Returns an invoice as html for a given period.

Parameters:
  • start_date – datetime.date object that marks the start of the interval of interest.
  • end_date – datetime.date object that marks the end of the interval of interest.
  • template – a jinja2 template string. If not given, the projects own invoice_template is used.
Returns:

The invoice as html for a given period.
get_activities_by_week(start_date, end_date, only_billable=True)[source]¶

Returns activities within requested date range aggregated by week.

Parameters:
  • start_date – datetime.date object that marks the start of the interval of interest.
  • end_date – datetime.date object that marks the end of the interval of interest.
  • only_billable – boolean. Default=True. Whether to return only billable activities
Returns:

a pandas.DataFrame containing the matched activities’ start, minutes, description and billable information.
get_activities_df(start_date, end_date, only_billable=True)[source]¶

Returns activities within requested date range as a pandas.DataFrame. Note that both start_date and end_date are included.

Parameters:
  • start_date – datetime.date object that marks the start of the interval of interest.
  • end_date – datetime.date object that marks the end of the interval of interest.
  • only_billable – boolean. Default=True. Whether to return only billable activities
Returns:

a pandas.DataFrame containing the matched activities’ start, minutes, description and billable information.
get_activities_dict(start_date, end_date, only_billable=True)[source]¶

Returns activities within requested date range. Note that both start_date and end_date are included.

Parameters:
  • start_date – datetime.date object that marks the start of the interval of interest.
  • end_date – datetime.date object that marks the end of the interval of interest.
  • only_billable – boolean. Default=True. Whether to return only billable activities
Returns:

a dictionary with sum being the total amount of minutes spent, and activities being a list of activities.
invoice_serialize()[source]¶

Serializes a limited number of attributes of this object, required for generating an invoice.

Returns:dict with parameters name and hourly_rate
remove_activity(activityid)[source]¶

Removes a given activity from this projects list of activities

Parameters:activityid – the id of the activity
serialize()[source]¶

Serializes this object

Returns:dict with parameters name, customer, company, hourly_rate, team and a list of activities
class webapp.models.Role(*args, **values)[source]¶

A role is used to determine the access level and permissions of a given user.

class webapp.models.Team(*args, **values)[source]¶

A team contains a number of members within a given company. A team can work together on a project.

serialize()[source]¶

Serialize this oject

Returns:dict with keys name, members (list)
class webapp.models.User(*args, **values)[source]¶

User class.

serialize()[source]¶

Serialize this object

Returns:dict with keys username, email and created_at
